etymologies: late 18th century: from French kilogramme (see kilo-, gram)

definitions: the SI unit of mass (equivalent to approximately 2.205 lb), first introduced as a unit of mass for the metric system.

notes.text: The kilogram was originally defined as the weight of a cubic decimeter of water at a particular temperature, this being represented for practical purposes by a metal cylinder of the same mass kept at Saint-Cloud near Paris. In 2019 it was redefined in terms of Planck’s constant
